biography:
Rogue Bard Media is a growing collective of like-minded artists in the metro-Detroit area whose interests range from Photography and Film production to illustration and writing. Consisting principally of Fyl, Dan, Krystal, and The Captain, the group is just starting to build some steam behind their plans to make an indelible mark on the Detroit scene, and one day the world.
___________________________________________As head of the organization I am responsible for deciding which projects we pursue and, more importantly, making sure everyone remains on task to see them through to completion. I have been producing event videos for four years and short films as far back as 1999. I've come a long way since my humble beginnings editing videos using two VCR decks and a disc-man to insert music, but even so I still end up pulling all-nighters to put the final touches on videos more often than not.
name: Fyl Frazee of Rogue Bard Media LLC

biography: My name's Joe Karame and I've been running JoeK Minis since 2010. It's a small business and it's been built up to provide me with an outlet for ideas and cool stuff to paint up! More than that, it allows me to work with some amazingly talented people in the hobby, and has given me the opportunity to meet loads of wonderful folk who like doing the same stuff as I do!I split my time in three. A third is devoted to designing kitchens...it's not glamorous, but it pays the majority of my bills. One third is painting miniatures for other people. I've been blessed to be the main studio painter for some fantastic companies (World of Twilight and Warpeloque miniatures are but two).  Making my own miniatures makes up the final third of my working life, and it's a direct result of my love of painting.It's not a bad life really!
name: JoeK Minis

biography: Mark Taormino is a Software Engineer, Game Developer and Actor. Over the last 30 years he has worked on commercial and non commercial computer games, Windows software, dozens of web database applications, including an entire social network and even business software. Some of those projects involved organizations like Viacom New Media, Warner Brothers, Encore Software, The LightSpan Partnership and many more. He also has been planning a few future Kickstarter feature film projects for scripts he has in the works.Recently he played in KESHA's "My Own Dance" music video, Lil Wayne's music video "Krazy" as the doctor who kicks down some knowledge to the rapper, and in an upcoming video for the Black Keys. He has also appeared on Travel Channels "Ghost Adventures" as Dr. George Hodel in the Black Dahlia episode.
name: Mark Taormino

biography:
Jay Silver is the Founder of Makey Makey/GameBender and was the first ever Maker Research Scientist at Intel. Jay's MIT PhD topic was World as Construction Kit. Jay's Drawdio was named Time's Top 15 Toys for Young Geniuses. Makey Makey Classic was Kickstarted for over $500,000, named Pop Sci Best of ToyFair, and inducted into the MoMA's permanent collection. Jay has been a speaker at many TED events, exhibited artwork internationally, and been named a Top 100 Inspirational World Changer by DELL. He sits on the board of directors of Maker Ed and the Sunseed Food Coop. Jay works with teens at places like Not Back to School Camp, and he believes that being a romantic is of the utmost importance.Formal Education:
- Bachelors from Georgia Tech, Electrical Engineering, named Engineer of the Year
- Master's from Cambridge University, Internet Technology, funded by Gates Scholarship
- Master’s from MIT Media Lab, Media Technology, funded by NSF Fellowship
- PhD from MIT Media Lab Lifelong Kindergarten, Lemelson Prize for Inventiveness
name: Jay Silver

biography:
Martin has been passionate about (designing) board games since a very early age, when he made custom Chutes & Ladders boards. 
He has published Scuba in 2016, The Dutch East Indies in 2017, and is now mostly publishing games from other authors and publishing licensed games. Monuments is his third game.
Besides this passion for (designing) boardgames, Martin also is a graduate in Business.
In 2012, he graduated as Bachelor of Science (BSc) in Business Administration.
In 2013, he graduated as Master of Science (MSc) in Marketing Management. 
This combination of a passion for (designing) boardgames and BSc and MSc degrees in Business is the key to why Keep Exploring Games can combine game design with game publishing, only having to outsource artwork, graphic design and advanced programming.
name: Martin Looij

biography:
Echo Chernik is an award winning advertising illustrator - Her work crosses the bordering from art nouveau into fileteado, cloisonne, stained glass window and all decorative styles.  Clients include Miller, Camel, Dos Equis, Trek Bicycles, Coors, Nascar, Rocket Dog Shoes, Celestial Seasonings, The Bellagio Resort, KMart, Sears, Dave Matthews Band, Arlo Guthrie, McDonalds, Shutterstock, Connecticut Opera, Langnese, Lerche, Publix, Disney, Mattel, Random House, Penguin and many more.  
She has begun creating her own artwork over the past few years.The Dessert Cthulhu Series started with Pie Cthulhu - whose popularity demanded a sequel.  Since then, she has been joined by Cupcake, Cookie, and Neopolitan Cthulhus (Chocolate, Strawberry and Vanilla), and the latest, Absinthe Cthulhu!Echo recently collaborated with Patrick Rothfuss on the very successful Name of the Wind Art deck kickstarter.
name: Echo Chernik

We make films, animation, special effects, visual experimentation, and unique projects that can't be easily named.Thanks to our childish impulse, we take advantage of our experience to materialize ideas into innovative projects. We retake techniques that are part of film history and give them a place in our present. We are from Mexico City and we want to do something good for our country.We are a friendly ghost, not one that scares.
